region_description: The region of North Africa has weak institutions, corruption risk is high and there are also strong climate problems. Aid money from abroad often goes through state elites and people do not trust where the money ends.

state.state_description: Egypt has strong, centralised power and weak transparency. There are many problems with corruption in public spending.

questions.question_text: After big floods in Egypt, international aid money arrives. NGOs warn that part of the money can go to elites and not people in need. What do you do?

possible_answers: Send money fast and trust the government
Make a small team to watch the money
Let local power groups decide alone
answers.right_answer: Make a small team to watch the money

questions.question_text: Reports say people must pay bribe to get access to food and water after a disaster. This happens in local offices, what is your move?

possible_answers: Say it is normal in crisis time
Open simple way to report bribes
Tell people to wait and be calm
answers.right_answer: Open simple way to report bribes

questions.question_text: One company close to the state wins rebuild contract after floods ended. There was basically no real competition. What do you do now?

possible_answers: Stop contract and check the deal details
Let it go just once to save time
Ask company to donate money later
answers.right_answer: Stop contract and check the deal details

questions.question_text: Journalists ask for gained data about public spending on the flood recovery. Officials refused. What do you say?
Young people protest against corruption in local offices after crisis. Police ask how to act towards protesters. What you tell them?
Foreign donors ask how aid money really helps people in Egypt, but the government feels insulted by this move. What do you do?

possible_answers: Share some basic results and numbers with them
Stop working with the donors since it was not respectful
Send only vague reports to avoid embarrassment
answers.right_answer: Share some basic results and numbers with them

region_description: Middle East has had long ongoing conflicts and strong corruption risks in some areas. Politics, security and public money are often mixed together too much.

state.state_description: Israel has strong institutions but faces huge corruption scandals, political tension and trust problems.

questions.question_text: A military equipment deal costs much more than it was originally expected and media talk about corruption links. What do you do?
Money for rebuilding damaged areas goes through many hands and the control is pretty weak. What is your move on this?
Several corruption scandals hit top politicians and public trust drops significantly. What is going to help the most now?
Aid groups warn that corruption helps armed groups gain support from local people. What will you focus on?
Public contracts are signed without transparency and citizens cannot access them. What change do you push?
People protest corruption during tense situation. Police ask how to react. What do you say?

region_description: Eastern Asia has generally fairly strong systems but faces problems with political funding, lobbying and close state business ties.

state.state_description: Japan has high trust, but struggles with political finance scandals and weird practices.

questions.question_text: Political group in Japan hides campaign money and does not report it. Media finds out. What should happen?
Senior officials leave public jobs and quickly join companies they controlled before. People talk about unfair ties. What do you do?
Big company pushes politicians when new law is written, all behind closed doors. What do you suggest?
Corruption news in Japan lowers trust even if the current trust level is low. What will help people trust again?
One ministry does not want share spending data with public. What now?
Whistleblowers fear punishment if they speak up. This stops reports, what is the best step?

region_description: North America has strong democratic institutions but it faces trust problems, money in politics and media pressure.

state.state_description: The US has strong laws but struggles with political funding, lobbying power and declining public trust.

questions.question_text: Large companies use big money to influence laws and elections. This causes significant trust problems. What you support?
Reports show foreign money may affect US elections. People worry about democracy. What will help the most?
Public trust in the government is low after several scandals. What do you focus on?
A judge has ethics problems and media talk about corruption. What should happen?
Local media lose money and close down. This hurts control over power. What do you do?
After corruption news, protests start in many cities. Police ask what to do. What do you say?
